75% of UK citizens aged 24 and younger voted to stay. Residents with higher education were slightly more likely to stay, and those with no formal qualifications were slightly more likely to leave. Also, turnout was low for residents younger than 24, thus if they were more turnout for that demographic, the UK may have remained in the EU. Source: http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/staggers/2016/06/how-did-different-demographic-groups-vote-eu-referendum

Whip in hand he attacked the merchants in the Temple area, causing a fracas (Matthew 21:12, Mark 11:15-16, Luke 19:45, John 2:15).
